reviews.review_msg: Much of the blame goes to the course itself. However, lecture delivery is poor. The lecture slides have very few points on them... And she talks too muchfast, making it difficult to make notes. They marking takes forever... The first assignment was graded like 3-4 weeks later.

The content of this course is pretty drydull and attending is a must bc there is participation grade and you will NOT do well if you don't attend - taking notes is a must. There is plenty of help from the prof and the TA I had was a huge help too. You can do well if you put the effort in - but it may be more effort than you're willing to put in

Dr. Martin is a passionate and kind person. Although history courses are not my favorite, Dr. Martin intrigues me with his passion. He's a fair marker, you will get the mark you deserve. Do the readings before class so you can participate in the discussion!
